meanings.definition: To cover the eyes with a cloth or bandage in order to prevent seeing.
meanings.sent1: She was blindfolding him for a surprise game.
meanings.sent2: The magician was blindfolding the volunteer before the trick.
meanings.sent3: The kids were blindfolding each other during the game of hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Blindfolding yourself to the truth will not make it disappear.
meanings.sent5: Blindfolding the suspect helped in the investigation.

meanings.definition: The act of covering the eyes with a cloth or bandage in order to prevent seeing.

meanings.sent3: The blindfolding at the party led to some hilarious mix-ups.
meanings.sent4: In the darkness of the cave, the blindfolding heightened their other senses.
